events.title: Paul Revere's Midnight Ride
events.description: Paul Revere and other riders warned the colonial militia in Massachusetts of the approaching British forces before the battles of Lexington and Concord, marking the start of the American Revolutionary War.
events.significance: This event triggered the open conflict between the Thirteen Colonies and Great Britain, ultimately leading to American independence.

events.title: San Francisco Earthquake
events.description: A devastating earthquake struck San Francisco, California, followed by widespread fires that destroyed much of the city.
events.significance: One of the most significant natural disasters in U.S. history, it led to major changes in earthquake engineering and urban planning.

events.title: Deaths of Albert Einstein and Thomas Mann
events.description: Famous physicist Albert Einstein and notable writer Thomas Mann both died on April 18, 1955.
events.significance: The passing of two influential figures in science and literature marked the end of an era in their respective fields.

events.title: Princess Grace of Monaco Dies
events.description: Grace Kelly, former American actress and Princess of Monaco, died after a tragic car accident.
events.significance: Her death was widely mourned globally and marked a significant cultural loss given her impact on film and humanitarian work.
